feedback.Physical object: Included — A snowflake is a discrete, tangible entity with defined form.
feedback.Man-made / synthetic: Excluded — It occurs naturally through atmospheric processes.
feedback.Biological or biologically-inspired: Excluded — It is a physical crystal, not derived from or modeled on biology.
feedback.Fixed/static: Included — Once formed, its geometry is stable (until it melts).
feedback.Structural: Included — Exhibits a defined internal lattice structure (hexagonal symmetry).
feedback.Perceptible: Included — Can be seen with the naked eye or microscope.
feedback.Material form: Included — Made of condensed water in solid (ice) form.
feedback.Passive: Included — Has no active function or energy output; it simply exists.
feedback.Purposeful / intentional: Excluded — Not designed or built with intent; emerges from natural physics.
feedback.Emits output / produces effect: Excluded — Does not emit signals, energy, or produce active effects.
feedback.Processes or regulates logic/signals: Excluded — No capacity for processing information or signals.
feedback.Transforms or modifies internal state: Excluded — Does not change its own state intentionally or persistently.
feedback.Interacts with humans directly: Excluded — Can be touched or observed, but has no designed interaction.
feedback.Part of a larger system: Excluded — Not inherently a subsystem; exists independently in nature.
feedback.Autonomous in function: Excluded — Has no functional behavior or self-driven process.
feedback.System-critical: Excluded — Not essential to any operational system by itself.
feedback.Symbolic / representational: Excluded — May be used symbolically in culture, but this is external attribution.
feedback.Communicative: Excluded — Does not convey or encode information by design.
feedback.Logical / rule-based: Excluded — Its shape is governed by physical rules, but it is not itself a logic structure.
feedback.Hierarchical / modular: Excluded — Geometric symmetry exists, but it is not built as a modular hierarchy.
feedback.Behavior-guiding: Excluded — Has no influence on behavior.
feedback.Self-referential / meta-conceptual: Excluded — Does not model or reference itself or abstract concepts.
feedback.Temporal: Excluded — Exists over time, but time is not an identity-defining feature.
feedback.Contextual abstraction: Excluded — Not an abstraction or generalization.
feedback.Socially / culturally constructed: Excluded — Exists independently of human classification or invention.
feedback.Defined by a group/system: Excluded — It is a natural formation, not institutionally defined.
feedback.Linked to identity or role: Excluded — Not associated with personal or group identity.
feedback.Regulated / governed: Excluded — Not subject to social or legal regulation.
feedback.Teachable / transmissible: Excluded — It is a natural object, not an instructional medium.
feedback.Visible: Excluded — Perceptible in the physical sense, but not symbolically or socially visible.
feedback.Context-sensitive: Excluded — Its identity does not change based on social or functional context.
feedback.Widely known: Included — Snowflakes are globally recognized phenomena across cultures.

encoding_notes: This encoding treats the snowflake as a specific instance of a naturally formed ice crystal, not as a cultural or symbolic motif. Traits are limited strictly to physical structure and recognition. No symbolic, logical, or functional attributes are inferred beyond observable material properties.
